highlights: MULTI LEVEL ACTIVITY CENTER- The four level design of this PETMAKER Cat tree provides numerous levels of fun and allows your favorite feline to jump and explore the cat tower. Perfect for kittens or cats that love to climb, and for multiple cat use!

COZY LOUNGING AREAS- Cats love nothing more than to snuggle up after exercising. Each tier contains plush and comfy areas for your furry friend to peacefully relax or nap. The cat condo is an ideal cove for hiding and sleeping, while the platforms and bed/perch area lets your cat fulfill their need of sitting at a higher level and allows them to look out over their surroundings.

SCRATCH AND PLAY SPACE- The tiered cat tree has multiple scratching posts to give your cat a healthy outlet for their scratching needs, instead of using your furniture or carpet! The sisal rope scratchers on the cat tower are naturally durable and safe for your pet to use and the differing levels of the posts also help cats to stretch and tone muscle. Not only is this the perfect scratching platform, it is also ideal for playing to expend some of the energy of a younger kitten!

PRODUCT DETAILS- Dimensions: 22.5” (L) x 16.5” (W) x 43”(H). Color: Brown. Spot clean or hand vacuum. Particle board construction covered in 100% polyester plush fabric, sisal scratching post. Recommended for all cats and kittens 10 weeks or older

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFNT3SMTXC2E5OK6OBQG7EL6D7LA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2020
reviews.review:
\n First off, listen to the instructions. I looked at them, then tossed them aside dismissively, only to realize that the backwards-seeming instructions were actually correct. Ah well... The cat avoided it for a few days, prolly because of the new thing in the house smell, but she loves it. I have it near a window so she can watch the birds and squirrels from it.

She completely ignores the top level, so I placed a large 10" potted plant on that level. I have noticed when she vigorously plays with it, it wobbles a bit, but not in any danger of falling over. It does collect cat hair and when she scratches the posts, small bits of the rope collect over time, so I keep a garment lint thingamabobber to collect cat hair and rope bits every few days. All in all, well worth the money spent.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFOYM4YFHCRHKBR4FWLFBKM4C5XQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2020
reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  This should be for kittens only not for an adult cat extremely thin and not sturdy. My cats hate it. The material is very soft but super thin, So I’m not really understanding how the product make her thought that would be appealing when I cat goes to scratch on this item. I’m going to see if I can salvage it by adding a Sturdier base and wrapping the poles with something else. To whoever created this item thanks for a pain in the ass ! good job idiot!\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AG76ZFDER26OV5FYZTEDPGSW7CNQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2019
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 3 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  This is a good product for the money. It wobbles a little when my cat jumps up on it and the scratching posts don\'t seem to be in a good position for him to actually use them. But my cat lays on the top and looks out the window or naps and he is very contented so that\'s good enough for me.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AEULL33RZRNYL4SODLHVCU7PRTZQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2020
reviews.review:
\n We were looking for two cat trees for our two cats (8.5 years old and 9 months), and we thought this would be perfect for the 9 month old kitten. We were right! He loves climbing it and playing with the attached ball on the string, which surprisingly is still attached after weeks of use.

The only "complaints" I have would be that it does seem to wobble a bit if he jumps on it too quickly when he has the zoomies (we do have it positioned between a wall and the end of a couch, so I\'m not sure if it would have tumbled by now without that extra support), and the hole in the second-to-top level is in a bit of an odd spot. He likes to lay down and always ends up with a limb or two hanging through it. I wish it were more off to the side to give a bit more room for kitty lounging.

If you\'re looking for something at a good price point that gets the job done, this is it! Attached a couple photos--don\'t have a good photo of the whole thing because of how it is positioned.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFF5RXJ6HUVKYY7X7VYLZIJZA6XQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2022
reviews.review: \n  Was smaller than expected. I have 3 adult cats. They don’t like it because it rocks. The bed is too small for adult cats. I was looking for a cheap replacement for their older n bigger tree that they tore apart (which is what it’s for). Also not a great color selection.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AEPKEFCBRQ54KXRC6JPHQO5S74WA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 2 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  My cat doesn’t like it, but it’s well made for the price, easy to assemble. Good value for the money.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFTJRP7DT2YWMLHUSOMDVJE7H7OQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2021
reviews.review: \n  This was easy to assemble and my Cat seems to love it\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHP6FWWZDVLWIFIZ72UIA74JFFHQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2020
reviews.review: \n  Easy assembly; good scratching post\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFAQL6EIZDSSGWIW6HSEHPUQVY3A
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2020
reviews.review: \n  We’ve had this for about a week now and our kitty cat loves it! It was easy to assemble, it took maybe 15 minutes or so to assemble. My cat loves to climb it and because of the scratching posts we’ve she hasn’t scratched the couch nearly as much. It’s a great cat tree for our medium sized cat. The only issue we’ve come across is that it shakes a little but on hard floors it doesn’t. Great purchase, worth the money!\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AERSHXTCZO4D3HBWO7C7IWRBI53Q
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2019
reviews.review: \n  You get what you pay for. It\'s cheap, so if that\'s what you want then this is the cat tree for you. I\'d suggest spending an extra $20 and getting a nicer one.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFMXMUYYSFDEM6SMNKVNEGHUXQMQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2020
reviews.review: \n  I would say this product is just as I expected from the pictures. my cat is playing in it a lot!\n

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020
reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review_title: Received wrong pieces and very cheap parts.
reviews.review: \n  I received the wrong piece for the middle section. The holes are drilled in the wrong place.  Plus the carpet is so cheap cat is clawing wood.  $65 is now cheap but I received a $20 tree.  One more item, tree is a kittens only.  I have a small cat and it\'s to small.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHSSBBMASEIV5XPRAJNIDOUKCYSA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2019
reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  It’s cute. Perfect size. I took off a star because it’s a little wobbly.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFORZDIV7MDBPTCNFNFF4ONR3FFA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020
reviews.review_title: Sturdy enough for a cat to jump off of.
reviews.review: \n  This has been perfect for my aging cat as she is not able to climb or jump as well as she used to. It is soft and inviting and she usually hangs out on the top and curls up in a little ball.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AEXNCF5QO2TUGDJHHPWF4LKXTZPQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2019
reviews.review_title: Biggie Smalls loves his new condo!
reviews.review: \n  Great fabric and easy to build!  Our cat, Biggie Smalls is Twenty pounds loves the different levels. Top level is mall for him to lay in.\n

reviews.review: \n  Not as tall between steps than it shows.  Wish it has areas for toys.\n

reviews.review: \n  My cat likes this cat tree, tall & big enough for her. A little wobbly since it doesn\'t anchor to the wall but I\'ve had it for a few weeks now & it hasn\'t tumbled over.\n

reviews.review: \n  It\'s was perfect to set up next to a window for my cats to bird watch and get some sun as well.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFFM4BNI5FVLX5IUTSKXXEI4AVXQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2022
reviews.review: \n  I love that it has long scratching posts, my cat uses those all the time and its not just soft padding so its not getting torn up. Its a great color and size doesnt overwhelm the room and high enough to give kitty a better view. Slightly unstable wheen he gets the zoomies and jumps straight to the top so i have little weight on the back and there is no issue!!! Recommend\n
